Title.evidence: The present study was designed to evaluate the effects of preoperative Lugol solution on thyroid vascularization and surgical morbidity in patients with Graves’ disease undergoing total thyroidectomy.

Trial_Design.evidence: Fifty-six patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease were randomly assigned to receive 7 days of Lugol treatment (Lugol+ group, 29) or no Lugol treatment (LS– group, 27) before surgery in this single-centre and single-blinded trial.

Participants.evidence: Fifty-six patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease were randomly assigned to receive 7 days of Lugol treatment (Lugol+ group, 29) or no Lugol treatment (LS– group, 27) before surgery in this single-centre and single-blinded trial.

Intervention.evidence: Fifty-six patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease were randomly assigned to receive 7 days of Lugol treatment (Lugol+ group, 29) or no Lugol treatment (LS– group, 27) before surgery.

Objective.evidence: The present study was designed to evaluate the effects of preoperative Lugol solution on thyroid vascularization and surgical morbidity in patients with Graves’ disease undergoing total thyroidectomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative and postoperative blood loss.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Fifty-six patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease were randomly assigned to receive 7 days of Lugol treatment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifty-six patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease were randomly assigned.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No differences between T0 and T1 were found for ultrasonographic vascularization in either group, nor did the histological findings differ.

Harms.evidence: No differences between T0 and T1 were found for ultrasonographic vascularization in either group, nor did the histological findings differ.
